description.narrative:
Centre for community and environment (CECR) is a Vietnamese NGO that coordinate the Clean water coalition. Within this project CECRand coalition will do advocacy for 2 policy processes, these are including continuing to advocate the National Assembly toagree including the new law on water pollution control in the new NA legislation agenda period from 2016-2021, and the second to monitor implementation of portions of the 2014 Environmental Protection Law relating to water pollution in 5 provinces / cities.
For the proposal of the law on water pollution control, the coalition will cooperate with VUSTA and Pollution control department of the Ministry of Natural resource and environment to conduct study and develop the proposal package, which will be used to advocate the ministry and National assembly.
The evidence of water pollution and results from community monitoring to prevent and reduce the water pollution at the provincial level are not only good for the water quality at localities, but will also be used as evidents for advocacy for the law.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Environmental and Commun Research

Centre for Environmental and Community Research (CECR) is a Vietnamese non-governmental organization (VNGO) based in Ha Noi. Established in 2009, CECR believes that solutions for present environmental issues need implementing in local areas. These solutions must be developed and adpoted by citizens, resulting in the change in attitude and behaviour of community and individuals towards positive enviroment protection. CECR works with other Clean Water Coalition's members, such as Centre for Environment and Community Development (CECoD), Tây B#c University. Oxfam partly funds and supports in technical aspect for Clean Water Coalition. CECR represents Clean Water Coalition to receive fund and register with relating authorities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

receiver-org.narrative: Centre for Environmental and Commun Research
